venue.name: Myles Standish State Forest Curlew Pond campground entrance

item.description:
Myles Standish State Forest is the biggest parkland in eastern Massachusetts. We invite you to explore the little visited areas north and west of the Curlew Pond campground including the scenic Sly Ponds and Manter's Hole.

The hike will be 4 miles and should take about 2 hours. The land is rolling with some sandy areas, so good hiking shoes

are recommended. Bring water and snacks.

 

The GPS track shown is from the Thursday Hiking Club's first explorations of this area in March.
item.how_to_find_us: Follow signs in the State Forest to Curlew Pond. The parking area and trail head is 0.4 miles up Curlew Pond Road from Rocky Pond Road.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Northwest Passage-- National Trails Day and June First Sunday hike
